intro: Petrophile heterophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaf rock-heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, narrow leaves and showy pink or red flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in coastal or inland regions. It is well adapted to arid conditions and can thrive in full sun. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an important species in ecological studies of arid environments.
